Reviews.Title: “Drunk guy in the neighbour room”
Reviews.Author: inakijav
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK. Big rooms. I could not sleep because there was a drunk guy next to our room who was alone and was singing war songs during all the night. He also spoke alone like a priest during the night. I called the night front desk and they told me they could not do anything about the situation. The front desk service was not good also.

Reviews.Title: “Good accomodation at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: ulurusunset
Reviews.Content: Important note: Meanwhile the hotel has changed his name into Rodeway Inn Hollywood. We chose this budget motel as last accomodation on our round-the-world-trip. Our room on the upper floor was of medium size, simply appointed, but nice. It featured two queen size beds. Since the weather was nice, in the morning we took the free breakfast on the terrace in front of our room with a view on the pool:-) Good way to start the day! Since we had a rental car, we were glad the hotel offered also free parking. It's a good place to stay for a couple of nights. It's a motel and you cannot have high expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Very Accommodating”
Reviews.Author: Chris32051
Reviews.Content: This was such a good experience. When I arrived, my reservation (though I had a confirmation at home) did not show up on the records of the hotel. The Clerk was extremely helpful, and got me settled into a nice, clean, secure, quiet room. I was in town to see an Irish tenor (Paul Byrom), and I noticed directly across the street from the hotel was an Irish Gift Shop. It was a perfect location for me, for the tone of my event. The property is located next to Vons market, and Starbucks very close by, not to mention the close proximity of the theatre, Melrose shopping district, Farmers Market, and all the beautiful Hollywood stately homes. I enjoyed the whole trip, and the comfort of the (now) RodewayInn at 777 Vine...was just great.

Reviews.Title: “A nice bargain”
Reviews.Author: D S
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews and booked this hotel at the last minute. Other places were a little expensive. Pros: good location near Hollywood with ample gated parking at the back. A convenience store, subway, panda express and Starbucks next door. This is probably not a neighborhood to walk around at nite but we had a car and had no problems driving a short distance to the Hollywood attractions. Breakfast isn't really anything except coffee and stale pastries. The wifi is good and bed and room were adequate. Overall a good bargain for money and location. I guess this was earlier and econolodge bu now it is branded as rodeway inn.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and price”
Reviews.Author: Maile89
Reviews.Content: For the price we weren't expecting much so it was a nice to have a pool, large room, toiletries and good location. There were some quite shady types staying there whilst we were there who were very loud around the courtyard which ruined it a bit but the staff did eventually throw them out. The breakfast was atrocious! A few stale donuts is definitely not a continental breakfast which was the biggest disappointment of our stay. The room was clean but the dark dull furniture made it look dated and dirtier than it was. But the staff were very helpful throughout our stay and in particular when we forgot we needed to check out and so were an hour late to check out but they didn't charge us for our idiocy. Would recommend if you're looking for a well priced stay in a good location

Reviews.Title: “It's an Econoldge After All”
Reviews.Author: BigGuy042
Reviews.Content: Checked into the Econolodge after staying at the Orchid Suites as we needed something reasonable priced in the Hollywood area. After reading other reviews on this property, thought for the price, it was worth giving a try. The hotel itself has an interesting layout, with a courtyard pool. Upon check-in, you are met by hotel staff who are behind glass. Needless to say, this was a little disconcerting, as the area is a bit sketchy. Got checked in and was given room 227. The room was facing Vine, with major road noise, due to insufficient windows and proximity to the street. Even with the air conditioner cranked, the road noise was unbearable. Went to the front desk to ask to be moved to a quieter room, but was told that none were available. Went to the grocery store around the corner to buy earplugs in order to sleep. The floor felt dirty, the air conditioner let out a smell of urine and the filter looked like it hadn't been cleaned in years. Not a great first impression, to say the least. On morning 2, I went back down to ask for a quieter room, for which the staff obliged. In the meantime, stopped for the continental breakfast, which consists of two boxes of dounuts from the store just down the street. It is an Econolodge after all. The room we were moved into was noticeably better than the previous nights lodging. Newer carpet, larger room, flat screen T.V. and no traffic noise. Truly a different experience from the night before. Not outstanding, but certainly far better than night one. Overall, this hotel was very reasonably priced for the Hollywood area. If I had the same room both nights, I would have given it a better rating. It is, after all, an Econolodge, and you clearly get what you pay for. It was an adequate stay, but if I am ever in the area again, I am likely to take a pass and try out some of the other hotels. If you choose to stay there, make sure you request a room away from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Coffee maker had old moldy filter in it, then they charged us 50.00 for it after checkout”
Reviews.Author: drj2010
Reviews.Content: Arrived July 9 for 4 day reservation. There was no one at the front desk to check us in. Had a look around while waiting. Place looked fine as others have commented. Lady arrived and checked us in to room 108. Went to room and it smelled like urine and musty. Turned on air for a while and it was better. Went to the front desk to request an extra pillow and the lady was most helpful...we went to the storeroom and she provided the pillow. A short time after the wife went to make a coffee with in room maker. She found an old very moldy used coffee filter in the maker. I took the coffee maker (minus the carafe) to the front desk and showed the lady and asked for a different maker. She explained the room had not been used due to a lock replacement issue so that sounded reasonable as to why the filter was that moldy, having been left there for sometime. The lady and I went to the storeroom but she was unable to find an extra. I told her my wife really didn't want to use or have the moldy coffee maker in the room so the lady said she would have it cleaned and replaced. It never was replaced but since wee were busy touring hollywood and universal over the 4 days it wasn't a major issue. A couple days later I saw a 50.00 usd charge on the visa so I called choice hotels international (ashley) to report the illegal charge. Ashley said hotel has 7 days to respond. I confirmed our home phone number but said we would be on the road for another week.. Arrived home and there was no message from the hotel so I called the hotel direct on July 23 and gave date of stay and clerk was confused why I was calling about a past stay and said to call manager (Karen Anderson). In the meantime I called choice hotels international to follow up on the file and Sarah said her records show the hotel never responded but also said the complaint is marked "international" and she didn't understand why. She said international complaints have 7-10 days to respond and it has only been 7. She put me on hold to call the hotel direct then came back on the line and said the hotel rep had hung up on her! I asked her to document this as it doesn't seem wise for an employee of the franchisee to hand up on the franchisor! Sarah said she would try to contact the manager later and get back to me. Sarah said to check my original bill as I didn't know the name of the lady who checked me in and had possession of the coffee maker so I did. The invoice indicates Karen Anderson, the helpful lady, had checked us in so it seems that housekeeping hasn't communicated with her or they would know why, and where the coffee maker is. I am somewhat annoyed that I have had to spend this much time resolving the 50.00 charge particularly as we never had use of it for the 4 days. That is where I am at right now so we'll see how Choice hotels and Karen deal with this.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: mattpet
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and spacious, beds comfortable. Had trouble making the wireless internet work while we were there, and staff was slow checking us in. The price was reasonable and the pool was nice and well kept. Walk of stars and Hollywood sign are nearby. I'd recommend it if you're in the Hollywood area.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the faint of heart”
Reviews.Author: kix1007
Reviews.Content: The first couple hours of the stay really were pretty good. The manager was kind enough to fax a couple important documents for me without any charge which I thought was quite nice. Then my girlfriend and I settled into the room and noticed that the bottoms of our feet were both filthy dirty, and we had just taken off our socks ten minutes earlier. We cleaned ourself up and then took a wet rag and wiped across the carpet and the dirt had come from there. The entire carpet was dark colored and filthy. We asked them to provide us towels so we could at least cover the carpet which they did do but at this point, we had lost all confidence in the cleanliness of the room. I totally realize that it is an economy motel, but to have my feel get dirty by walking around in my room is pretty sad. Kind of made my skin crawl.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast is good if you are dieting [ as you will not eat more !]”
Reviews.Author: Chote123
Reviews.Content: The photos & few good words about this hotel made me book a room here. But believe me , it wa not even 50% of what I expected !!...The hotel ambience is very ordinary & so are the rooms. breakfast counter is in the reception & I didnt see anything there other than couple of donuts..... You better avoid this place unless your are getting it for free...

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: BryantTexas
Reviews.Content: good hotel tom live in good rooms with 900 good roooms

Reviews.Title: “Vintage 70's Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaM-GreenBay
Reviews.Content: Viewed all opinions on this website and determined this hotel would be good for my husband and me. We were in Los Angeles for eight nights, five at the Econo Lodge. Our goal was to see Hollywood and experience Los Angeles. The hotel was for sleeping, showering, and resting. We arrived at 6:00p.m. and were shown our room. It was room #105, pool level, non-smoking, king size bed. After reading the reviews I examined the room carefully and found it clean and orderly. There were no ants, the carpet was clean, the sheets were fresh smelling and clean, and the bathroom appeared to have recently been remodeled. The hotel reminded me of the many road trip vacations taken during the 60s and 70s with my parents. This is a MOTEL, not a HOTEL. What did I like about this motel? The clean room, the laundry, the general vintage appeal, and the grocery store right next door!! I walked to the grocery store every morning to get my fresh fruit and Starbucks coffee. There is also a Panda Express and a deli. Yes, there is breakfast with donuts, english muffins, coffee, tea, and a juice product (Hi-C while we were there). The donuts were not "prepackaged" items, they were purchased from the Yum Yum donut store on the corner every morning. The toaster was not broken, it worked perfectly. My husband loved the donuts, I prefer fresh fruit and yogurt. To further my list of "likes" I utilized the fridge and microwave every day. It stored soda pop, milk, fruit, yogurt, and bottles of water. The microwave worked great to heat up left over food. What didn't I like about the hotel? Well, it was hard to find much wrong except perhaps the cobweb hanging from the ceiling in the main room area. I snatched it down with a towel - you may find cobwebs at my house too! Further, perhaps the area? I can't complain about the area as we chose to stay in Hollywood and were well aware of the "night" activity in the area. During the day the area is fine, yet at night there are numerous street people as there are in ALL areas of Los Angeles. We walked during the day and up until 1:30a.m. while we were there and never once were bothered by anyone. Be both confident and aware of your surroundings as you should be in any city. Also, it is true the walls are thin and you can hear people outside and above you, but that is a common thing with all older lodging facilities. Now, I have to throw this into the review.....we stayed one night at the Roosevelt Hotel (big 5 star hotel which we paid $280 for one night, stayed next to the Marilyn Monroe room) and I say the Econo Lodge was far better than the Roosevelt. The hallways at the Roosevelt are dark and had an odor. Dark brown carpet, tan walls, dark brown doors, and absolutely no wall decorations at all.. The room was similar to the Econo Lodge, perhaps more plain in the color scheme. We also stayed one night at the Beverly Hills Hotel and as expected it was an EXTRAVAGANT, POSH experience which was far above the Econo Lodge, but the price was six times the Econo Lodge also!! We will be returning to California in the next six months and plan to stay at the Econo Lodge again with our three children. The hotel suited our needs, was clean, and the staff was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great - and true value for the money”
Reviews.Author: RealSlowMoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Econo lodge last year. Nice little lodge with pool in the middle - a bit Melrose Place alike, Room is discount and used but not in a bad way, since it's clean. Try to get a room facing the pool. Breakfast included, with nice doughnuts and some bred and cerials. Very close to Hollywood Blvd. and Kodak Theatre - which is not actually all that... But good spot and seems fairly good and safe. We spend a lot of time checking for a safe and good deal and this did the job !

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean LA Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinVagabond
Reviews.Content: This is the least expensive motel we found in LA with acceptable reviewer ratings. For two people we paid $63.74/nite ($72.66 with tax) using the Go West Rate on the ChoiceHotels website, which offers a number of name-brand properties under $100. You must give a credit card to hold the room, but can cancel for free until 4PM on the day of arrival. This is a basic motor hotel, with room doors opening into a courtyard with a pool. We walked the 1 mile north to Hollywood Blvd, and found the neighborhood ok. We did no walking at night, but there is nothing really to walk to in the area. We did not see anything particularly menacing in our nighttime drives to and from the hotel. There is a Starbucks and a 24-hour Pavilions/Von's super market next door to the south at Melrose Blvd, and a CVS a block north. We stayed here for 4 nights, and had no problems. The walls are quite thin, as you could hear coughing and conversation from the next room. Luckily our neighbors were relatively quiet. If you had loud neighbors and were a light sleeper, this could be a problem for you. Although missing the advertised clock/radio, our room did have a coffeemaker, hair dryer, and the refrigerator and microwave oven came in handy. The hotel offers both wireless Internet and a guest laundry, but we used neither to attest to their quality. There was free coffee and donuts in the lobby every morning. Note that the hotel charges your entire stay to your credit card upon your arrival, so if you are picky you may wish to inspect your room first. We had a late-night 11PM arrival, and had no problems. Our room was clean and large (some reviewers of other area hotels described those rooms as tiny), and the staff were ok. The owner even let us pick a lemon from the poolside tree. One of the best things is that the parking is free, protected inside the motel grounds, with access by automatic gate (but it opens for any car). There were always enough parking spaces, even with late night arrivals. (At one of the other ChoiceHotels, the Rodeway on Beverly Blvd, reviewers complained of not enough parking, so we chose the Econo Lodge for the ample parking, plus it was $10 cheaper). Many LA hotels charge for parking, so the free parking affectively lowers the total room rate. We would recommend this place for anyone wanting to save a buck. It ain't glamorous, but it's clean and acceptable for the few hours each day you are in your room.

Reviews.Title: “dirty, ants everywhere”
Reviews.Author: latka19
Reviews.Content: I wish I could give this econolodge a good review, however, there were ants in our room. While the location was quite convenient, there are also lots of other motels nearby, and I would not stay here again. The ants were disgusting. The bathroom was also dirty and dingy looking, and the toilet kept getting clogged. We had to ask for a plunger and then unclog it ourselves. Not a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Okay-ish”
Reviews.Author: SparklySilver
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights. The room was quite clean although the carpet had stains. The complimentary breakfast was poor, it felt like an afterthought. There was a choice of either donuts or English muffins - for which you had to use an old toaster which only had two slots, was very slow and also had broken knobs which cut into your thumbs when you press down on them. Coffee was available with this. It would be nice if the hotel supplied a healthier breakfast option, eg fruit, and fruit juice which would be better than coffee for any children staying. Thankfully there is a supermarket just a minute's walk away with a fabulous selection of fruit, yoghurts etc The reception staff didn't appear to be taking much notice who was walking through reception and into the actual area where the rooms were and from where the 'secure' car park could be accessed. The reception staff didn't seem all that attentive, friendly and helpful either when we spoke to them.

Reviews.Title: “This place is tops”
Reviews.Author: hpyglf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for a place to stay while our floors were being refinished. We live in the West Hollywood area and I checked all the named places on the Sunset Strip, west Hollywood, etc. How did I know it was the Grammy's this weekend. Everything was absolutely booked. Well, I finally found this place on the web and it had nice reviews, no excellent reviews except for some older ones. Anyway, we were desperate and signed up. Let me tell you, I a picky, but my wife is really picky. This place really fit the bill. The office folk were very nice and polite and we had no problem extending for two days (never believe your contractor). Things looked generally fresh, paint, carpet, etc., and all is very clean. The bathroom is spotless. There is a microwave, fridge, and coffee maker in the room, all very clean. The tv has only about eight channels, but I didn't come to watch tv. The pool is very clean as well. There are a lot of framed movie posters around and they all have turned blue from the sun. I wonder why. Oh, they even let us park both our cars without any extra charge. Security seems very good as cameras about. Last night we went to the Grove for a movie and ate across the street at a great Korean sushi restaurant. highly recommended. everything is close by here. today we went to the labrea tarpits and lacma, about a ten minute drive.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic, but clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: RJDLondon
Reviews.Content: Whilst the motel is definitely a budget standard, it was clean and tidy. Pretty dated to look at, the front desk staff weren't really interested in who was coming and going through the lobby, but the beds were comfortable and we didn't catch bed bugs! The traffic noise was bearable (ask for one on the far side of the pool, away from Vine St), the location was fine to walk around during the day but I'd stick to cabs at night, and there's a supermarket and Starbucks next door. The breakfast they provide is just donuts from the shop across the road. Good value for the location, and a fine base to explore the city from if you don't intend to spend much time there.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: wgemedicaid
Reviews.Content: After two lesser hotel experiences on a week's trip, this was a very pleasant surprise. The room was spacious with a large bath, ample closet, clean room and comfy bed. Very clean and well kept. We had selected largely on price and location (near stepdaughter's apartment) and had expected little for the low price. This is not a fancy place by any stretch of the imagination but we will use it again when we visit our stepdaughter. The breakfast was commercially wrapped pastries and coffee but we didn't expect much more. One downside was the poor picture quality of the TV not that we watched much TV.

Reviews.Title: “Better than reviews!”
Reviews.Author: glasships
Reviews.Content: This hotel must be under new management because the bad reviews are so off! This hotel is better than any of the 4 stars I usualy stay at. They are hassels- this is easy and nice! The nighborhood is not bad, its not beverly hills but its certainly better than anything in central LA!! Very nice room. Very easy parking. Aforadble. Safe and secure. I will be staying here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “nice little place you get what you pay for ”
Reviews.Author: jerry222
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week while our daughter attended Dance lessons at a local dance school. We were originally booked to stay 5 nights but we were having such a great time we decided to stay an extra 2 nights. The motel was clean and the pool was nice to swim in after a hot day. We were not expecting much before we arrived so we were pleasantly suprised after reading some bad reviews. IT IS WHAT IT IS. It's the ECONO lodge. Staff was friendly and when we needed them they were extremly helpful. We would stay here again as the location is close to Hollywood Blvd, close to shopping, 15 min to Universal studios, 30 min drive to Santa Monica Beach etc etc. Just don't expect the Hilton and maybe you won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood California Best Hotel in Los Angeles CA”
Reviews.Author: nikykil
Reviews.Content: yes i live in the uk & i have been to the econo lodge, 777 n vine street , hollywood,california 90038 for the past 7 years along with my best friend who is also british, we have stayed in this hotel every year, and found the staff to be excellent & helpful to name one staff members ms karen anderson, & the owners gt & shanta. the rates are affordale as well, and its so close to shops one can leave the car in the car park, and use public transport which is cheaper than some countries, a dayrider ticket pays for a train journey as well ! thanks from niky in the uk

Reviews.Title: “Vine & Melrose”
Reviews.Author: ohohla
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days there and liked the area of Melrose and Rossmore, just across from Hancock Park, Larchmont Village and next door to the Pavillions market. There were good inexpensive restaurants around the corner on Melrose and the location was convenient for driving, not far from Wilshire Museums and the Grove and walkable to Hollywood and Highland via Cole which runs parallel to Vine. Paramount Studios is walkable east on Melrose past Larchmont. The room had been refurbished and for the price it was a good deal when traveling alone on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive accommodation, not so bad, good for limited budget travelers”
Reviews.Author: Peter32
Reviews.Content: Sure it’s not the best place to stay if you like to spend more money for a better hotel. But it’s really a good place for budget travelers. I somehow agree with the review submitted by Meangreen that one guy at front desk is rude. In my case I experienced three different men at front desk. One of the men was totally rude. We got there for check in at about 7 pm and he was taking a nap. He didn’t even look at us entering the lobby. He was kind of angry why we were disturbing his nap! I asked him about the area and he didn’t like to talk. The other guy was okay and the last old guy was very nice. But the first one was enough to ruin the courtesy of the front desk. There was a refrigerator, coffee maker and microwave in our room that worked well. The room is a little small, but okay. The hotel is old, but not very dirty. The gated parking gave us the feel of being safe and secure that was very good. You can drive in to the gated parking and access your room from there. The breakfast was small, but not bad. It includes Coffee, bread, butter, jam and bagels. The hotel is less than 10 minutes drive from major Hollywood attractions. I recommended it if you are in a limited budget.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate lodging, but rude staff”
Reviews.Author: MeanGreen
Reviews.Content: Room was quite adequate, clean enough, not disgusting as reported by others. Grounds are secured by gate, so we felt safe. Razor wire just gave the perception of an unsafe place. Fridge in room didn't work. Fortunately, we didn't need it. Cont breakfast very sparse, basically coffee and a donut. Two major complaints: the amount of light coming into the room at night. The courtyard is lit up all night like a stadium. Second, the staff (only one person, actually) didn't really care whether we were there or not. Never any greeting or "thank you" or "have a nice day" or anything. Not to mention the fact that she was wearing the same outfit two days in a row! I should mention that the shower was great, very good pressure. Like I said, the room was just fine for our family of four, but I wouldn't stay here more than one night.

Reviews.Title: “Very Unsafe and Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel! There is mold everywhere. The price is too high and the tiolet, heater and television was broke. They would not refund our money or give us another room. They were very very rude and drug dealers were on the corner all night. We thought that our car would be stolen or killed if we went outside. Very unsafe!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: randinc
Reviews.Content: An older hotel but major refurbishing a couple of years ago. New windows and doors, air conditioning units, bath fixtures, the works. Kept neat and clean on a daily basis and given a deep cleaning when necessary. I've stayed here regularly for several years and watched the improvements. The hotel is built around a courtyard with a pool and pleasant and well kept garden. I often pick a lemon from the lemon tree. Secure parking via an electric gate adds to security. There's a great supermarket adjacent with a full deli and a Starbucks. The hotel provides in room coffee and a hair dryer. A month ago my family and stayed at another Hollywood hotel, paid twice the price, plus parking and had a dirty room because I wanted an indoor pool for the grandkids. Back to the Econolodge!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and cheap”
Reviews.Author: Ce
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights, the place is clean and is well protected (gated parking, dead bolts on doors). Microwave, fridge, clean sheets. Bathtub drain backs up. Cheap price, great if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: EugeneR
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a super low budget place that was still clean, friendly, and in a good location. We found all that and more at the Econo Lodge in Hollywood. The rooms we had were clean and large, with a balcony having a table with umbrella and chairs overlooking the pool. We were wonderfully surprised by the refrigerator and microwave that we found in each of our rooms. Even more pleasantly surprising, at least compared with my other west-coast trips to more expensive hotels was the terrific water pressure in the shower. While the hotel has obviously not been refurbished lately, everything was clean and the staff was responsive to our needs The beds were comforatable, and there was a desk in each room and enough electrical outlets to meet the needs of the various devices we needed to use and charge. The low price and good location, with convenient access to tourist spots, a supermarket down the block and a laundry mat including wash-n-fold service across the street let us have the trip we wanted on the small budget we had. The value for the price cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Worse place I have ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was unbelievably bad. The dark blue carpet was nasty and the room filthy. The towels were threadbare. The sheets had holes in them. The television barely worked. When I asked for a hair dryer, the guy at the desk said it had been stolen, so I was out of luck! Drunks carried on in the hallway until 4:00 a.m. and the manager did nothing. I was supposed to stay a week, but I checked out the next morning at 7:00 a.m.!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant "cheap motel"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms. Clean place, a good deal if you are looking for a reasonable price, clean, safe motel near the hollywood club scene. Close to a major supermarket. Staff was friendly.

HotelInfo.Name: Econo Lodge Hollywood
HotelInfo.Address: 777 North Vine Street, Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90038
